publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-724 Miss Annabel Goldie: Supreme Court-That the Parliament calls upon Her Majesty's Government, in the event of a United Kingdom Supreme Court being created, to ensure that both Scottish judges are appointed to sit in all civil appeals from Scotland and that decisions of the Supreme Court in non-Scottish cases are not binding in Scots law except in so far as the law determining such cases is applicable on a United Kingdom basis.
S2M-724 Supreme Court (lodged on 10 December 2003) Alex Fergusson*, Murdo Fraser*, Phil Gallie*, Robert Brown*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*

S2M-724 Miss Annabel Goldie: Supreme Court-That the Parliament calls upon Her Majesty's Government, in the event of a United Kingdom Supreme Court being created, to ensure both that Scottish judges are appointed to sit in all civil appeals from Scotland and that decisions of the Supreme Court in non-Scottish cases are not binding in Scots law except in so far as the law determining such cases is applicable on a United Kingdom basis. Supported by: Alex Fergusson, Murdo Fraser, Phil Gallie, Robert Brown, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, David McLetchie*
S2M-724 Supreme Court (lodged on 10 December 2003) Bill Aitken*, Mr David Davidson*
S2M-724 Supreme Court (lodged on 10 December 2003) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-724 Supreme Court (lodged on 10 December 2003) John Scott*
S2M-724 Supreme Court (lodged on 10 December 2003) Mary Scanlon*
S2M-724 Supreme Court (lodged on 10 December 2003) Christine Grahame*
S2M-724 Supreme Court (lodged on 10 December 2003) Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-724 Supreme Court (lodged on 10 December 2003) Brian Adam*, Dr Jean Turner*
